intro: Senecio apargiifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Senecio apargiifolius is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
